ygData.authorName: Reece Tom R CPT 25 ID L G4(n)
ygData.from: "Reece Tom R CPT 25 ID L G4(n)" <g4mntofcr@...>
ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Mistmoore Jail
ygData.msgSnippet: Wouldn t this be considered an exploit? I ve camped in the MM jail on numerous occasions but always before I got the chant songs.  Also was always in a group
ygData.messageBody:
Wouldn't this be considered an exploit?

I've camped in the MM jail on numerous occasions but always before I got the
chant songs. Also was always in a group so we just pulled them out of the
cells. I assume what you were doing was opening the doors, targetting one
of the mobs, closing the doors, and then chanting until the mob died.
Curious what happens when the first chant hits. If it is a caster mob, does
it cast through the door? Melee mobs? What about the mobs in the other
cells that you didn't target?

Galtin of E'ci

-----Original Message-----
From: John Tatsukawa [mailto:john@...]
Sent: Thursday, October 05, 2000 9:57 AM
To: eqbards@egroups.com; 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Mistmoore Jail


Maybe they've been nerfed since. I did indeed sit and chant everything in
the cells to death, repeatedly and they never moved. *shrug*.

I did this about 3 weeks ago and all 3 of them were chained. The two on the
left could move to the door, but couldn't strike very far beyond it.

I admit, I was surprised it wasn't always camped 24/7 as they were indeed
sitting ducks, except that casters were extremely dangerous. Also, the
wandering placeholder did make it a bit tougher.

---Windleaf

At 03:41 PM 10/5/00 -0400, Cyr, Thierry wrote:
>if the stuff cant get out it would be camped 24/7 as sitting ducks for
>caster types (or chants)
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
>Sent: October 5, 2000 3:31 PM
>To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
>Subject: [eqbards] Mistmoore Jail
>
>
>Stuff in the cells are chained? They sure didn't have any trouble chasing
>me halfway to the zone before I outran them. I hope you were kidding.
>
> Kit
